data.title: Update FrameBuffer.java due to problems with GWT.
data.body: Update FrameBuffer.java due to problems with GWT due to the use String.format method in an exception.

data.title: FileHandle.moveTo() Update
data.body:
delete() only deletes files and empty directories.  As such, moveTo() would leave the old directory after a moveTo() opperation.  By adding deleteDirectory(), this ensures the old copy is removed.

The test "if (exists () && isDirectory())" may not be needed, but is added for safety.

data.title: Fix SequenceAction skipping first action under certain circumstance
data.body: If this SequenceAction is freed during Line 61: actions.get(index).act(delta), next time this SequenceAction being obtained, index will start from 1.

data.title: Bullet: fix correct Model class, update swig, fix 1347 & 1453

data.title: [fixed] DefaultGroupStrategy now works with OpenGL 2.0
TexturePacker2 : make Page & Rect public to allow reuse in other projects
data.body: Just as the title says ; to avoid rewriting or copy pasting most of the code, this is needed to allow reuse (like in the ant task i proposed a few days ago).

data.title: Fix GLES10Shader texture wrap
Check for GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED error from glCheckFramebufferStatus
data.body:
According to the OpenGL ES 2.0 spec
(http://www.khronos.org/registry/gles/specs/2.0/es_cm_spec_2.0.24.pdf),
CheckFramebufferStatus can return FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED if e.g. the
texture isn't a color-renderable format. We should throw in that case,
not silently fail to work. Also throw for any other cases that aren't
FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE; according to the spec there shouldn't be any.

Also add some documentation about officially supported formats. In
particular, RGB888 and RGBA8888 do work on many devices, but aren't
listed in the spec as color-renderable formats.

data.title: SelectBox: maxListCount off-by-one bug quick fix
data.body:
The obsolete height-fitting code wasn't removed and is creating a chance to cause an off-by-one-item bug in the drop down box due to a possible precision loss from [ height -=  height % itemHeight ].

The problematic height fitting code is obsolete and unncessary as of the patch implementing maxListCount where the height is now calculated off the desired number of items and not prefHeight().  This fix simply removes the old code.

data.title: Test PR [possibly Github bug]
data.body:
This is a test to a possible bug which allows people with write access to neither fork (or indeed who dont have a fork of the repo at all) to open a PR.

Please do not merge this (I'll close it right away if I can actually create it -- if I can't please close it for me); it will be part of a bug report to Github support.

data.title: SelectBox: added set max # items to display in dropdown
data.body:
Added backwards compatible functionality for configuring the max # of items to display in the dropdown SelectList.

You set the maximum number of items you want displayed in the dropdown box until scrolling is required, or <= 0 to have it list them all, but should it reach the bottom/top of the screen then scrolling is required. 

This is also a solution to an API defect. Previously, there was no easy way to modify the inner SelectList's prefHeight() to adjust the dropdown list's displayed height.

data.title: List: Item Filtering Functionality
data.body:
I have two implementations of List Items filtering in this branch.  The decoupled solution will _not_ work with the embedded solution's List.java, so you must choose one or the other.

I prefer the embedded solution.

1) Embedded solution.- see List.java
2) Decoupled solution- see ListFilterable.java

data.title: TextField bug: DELETE char not notifying listener
data.body:
Quick fix.

When the DELETE key was pressed, it was returning before notifying the attached TextFieldListener that its respective TextField was changed.

If this is intended behavior (which I pray it isn't...), then we should at least be consistent and handle the BACKSPACE case the same way as well.

data.title: Add AnimationController & strong typed fixed length array to UBJsonReader
data.body:
UBJsonReader: See https://github.com/libgdx/fbx-conv/pull/18

This includes a first draft on an AnimationController. I've splitted it up into two parts:

BaseAnimationController:
Responsible for actually applying animations. It can either apply one animation (applyAnimation), blend two animations (applyAnimations) or blend multiple animations (begin(), apply(), end()). All these methods are protected for now, but perhaps it can be useful to have a derived class exposing these methods. This class introduces a Transform class for easily maintaining and blending transforms.

AnimationController:
A slightly higher level class that extends BaseAnimationController. It introduces a AnimationDesc class to keep track of animation states etc. which are pooled using a protected pool. Basically it has four methods:
- setAnimation: Set the current animation, without transition
- animate: Set the current animation, blending while transition with the previous animation if needed.
- queue: Queue an animation to be applied (using animate, thus blending) when the current animation finishes.
- action: Apply a (short) animation (using animate, thus blending) and then blend back to the previous animation.
  Every animation has a loopCount (number of times to play) and speed (1f for normal speed). Besides that the update(delta) can be used to alter the overall speed. The speed or delta can be negative to play animations in reverse. For debugging purposes the members (current animation, queued animation, etc.) are public for now.

It also includes an Animation3DTest which includes a skydome and concrete texture.

data.title: AndroidAudio uses multiple SoundPools to prevent heap size overflow
data.body:
I've requested this improvement here: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=9316&p=42143&hilit=soundpool#p42143
But I choose to start with it.

The changes I made:
- Remove the SoundPool from AndroidAudio and place it in SoundPoolContainer.
- A private class SoundPoolContainer which holds the SoundPool and checks whether the pool is full.
- When a pool is full it creates a new SoundPoolContainer, this will prevent heap size overflow.
- Currently the max stream is set to 15. You'll get about 15 x ~50 KB sound. You'll have enough space left.
- I can't not check the size of the sound file, that is way the counter is used to track the amount of sounds that is loaded in the SoundPool.

Change the naming if it doesn't suits you.

(It's my first pull request using GitHub, don't shout at me if I'm doing something wrong)

data.title: Update Shape.java
data.body:
Small ordinal fix in shape as per jniGetType(). 
Now Shape.Type.Polygon.ordinal() returns 2 as expected.

data.title: Defined ParameterizedPool class.
data.body:
I'm using an entity system where I wanted to pool entity objects.  I can't instantiate Entities directly, and instead need to pass the 'world' parameter to the newObject method.  I created the ParameterizedPool class which is essentially a copy of the Pool class with an extra parameter thrown in to allow this.

Others may find it useful.

data.title: Add ObjectFloatMap to gwt module definition
List: select 'nothing', and disable item selection
data.body:
This adds functionality to the List Actor so it may behave like that of a ListView akin to Android's.  This is backwards compatible.

This is essential in situations where you may not always want to have an item selected (like a touch-based file browser), or where you may not want items even selectable at all (like during a tutorial).

Also this fixes a bug/defect fix where if you look in the old setSelection(String name) method, you'll see it sets the selectedIndex to -1, then tries to find an item with that name.  When it doesn't, it leaves the selectedIndex not pointing to an item, -1, which isn't intended allowable behavior in the current version.

_Note_
When the List is NOT selectable, it will no longer eat its touch event meaning they will still propagate down.

I'm not 100% sure if that is the behavior you want versus the contrary where it eats the touch event despite not doing anything.  Regardless, I have a note of this behavior change in the setSelectable comment.

data.title: GestureDetector no longer consumes events.
data.body:
Reverting a previous change of mine. On closer inspection, having the
GestureDetector consume touch up or drag will likely cause some trouble.

data.title: Create Tick class in Utils
Fixed long presses being handled incorrectly.
data.body:
Fixed long presses causing events not to be consumed by the
GestureDetector. This issue was causing the GestureDetector to return
false in touchDragged and touchUp whenever a longPress returned true
resulting in unexpected behavior which one would likely only notice when
chaining InputProcessors in an InputMultiplexer.

data.title: Fix opacity on models
Fix for Issue 1470: On OS X TextField deletes symbols from the right side
data.body:
ref: https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1470

This pull request fixes the behavior of the backspace key in TextField on OS X.

On OS X, the KeyEvent.keyChar field on a Backspace press contains 127, not 8 as expected. This is what is reported by org.lwjgl.input.Keyboard.getEventCharacter().  

org.lwjgl.input.Keyboard.getEventKey() is distinguishing correctly between Backspace and Delete, so keyCode can be used to fix keyChar.
